flowMetadata.name: IT Ticket Routing - Automated
flowMetadata.description: Automatically creates and routes IT support tickets based on request category
flowMetadata.author: IT Automation Team
flowMetadata.note: This is a template. Actual flow JSON export contains tenant-specific IDs and must be imported through Power Automate portal.

trigger.displayName: When a new response is submitted

inputs.description: Replace YOUR_FORM_ID_HERE with actual form ID from Microsoft Forms

Creates empty string variable to store IT group assignment
Creates new ticket in SharePoint with all form data and assigned group

inputs.subject: Ticket Submitted - @{body('Get_response_details')?['r<BRIEF_SUMMARY_QUESTION_ID>']}
inputs.body:
Hello,

Your IT support request has been received and assigned to our @{variables('AssignedGroup')} team.

Ticket Details:

  • Issue: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}
  • Category: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}
  • Priority: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}
  • Assigned to: @{variables('AssignedGroup')}
  • Ticket ID: @{body('Create_item_in_Tickets_list')?['ID']}

Our team will review your request and respond as soon as possible based on the priority level.

Best regards,
IT Support Team

actions.description: Sends confirmation to user with ticket details

inputs.subject: New Ticket Assigned - @{body('Get_response_details')?['r<BRIEF_SUMMARY_QUESTION_ID>']}
inputs.body:
A new support ticket has been assigned to your team.

Ticket Information:

  • Ticket ID: @{body('Create_item_in_Tickets_list')?['ID']}
  • Issue: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}
  • Description: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}
  • Priority: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}
  • Category: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}
  • Requester: @{body('Get_response_details')?['responderEmail']}
  • Contact Email: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}
  • Location: @{body('Get_response_details')?['r']}

View ticket in SharePoint

Please review and update the ticket status as you work on this request.

actions.description: Notifies assigned IT group with full ticket details

placeholders.<FORM_QUESTION_ID>: Form question ID for 'Request Type' (e.g., r6b3a1c2d...)

dynamicContentMapping.howToFind: In Power Automate, use dynamic content picker to select form fields. The IDs are auto-generated.

steps: 1. Open Power Automate (https://make.powerautomate.com)
2. Create new Automated cloud flow
3. Add trigger: Microsoft Forms - When a new response is submitted
4. Select your IT Support Request form
5. Add action: Forms - Get response details
6. Add action: Variables - Initialize variable (name: AssignedGroup, type: String)
7. Add nested conditions following the logic in this template
8. Add action: SharePoint - Create item
9. Map all form fields to SharePoint columns
10. Add action: Outlook - Send email (user confirmation)
11. Add action: Outlook - Send email (team notification)
12. Save and test with sample form submission
13. Monitor run history for any errors
1. In an existing flow, click 'Export' → 'Package (.zip)'
2. Download the package
3. In target environment, click 'Import' → 'Import Package'
4. Upload the .zip file
5. Configure all connections (Forms, SharePoint, Outlook)
6. Update site URLs and list names
7. Test thoroughly before enabling
limitations: SharePoint site URLs must be updated

optimization: Use variables to avoid repeated API calls
Consider using Switch control for >4 categories

commonIssues.issue: Flow fails with 'Access Denied' on SharePoint
commonIssues.cause: Insufficient permissions for flow service account
commonIssues.solution: Grant Contribute permission to the account running the flow on Tickets list

commonIssues.cause: Condition logic not matching any category
commonIssues.solution: Verify 'contains' operator is used and spelling matches form exactly

commonIssues.cause: Invalid email address or group not mail-enabled
commonIssues.solution: Verify IT groups are Microsoft 365 Groups with email enabled

commonIssues.cause: Trigger polling interval or form connection issue
commonIssues.solution: Check flow trigger history, verify form ID is correct, re-authenticate connection

name: IT Ticket Routing – Microsoft Forms to SharePoint
description: This flow automatically creates IT tickets in SharePoint based on Microsoft Forms submissions and assigns them to Microsoft 365 groups using conditional logic.

trigger.action: When a new response is submitted
trigger.description: Triggered whenever a user submits the IT Support Request form.

actions.name: Get response details
actions.description: Retrieves all answers submitted in the form.

actions.name: Initialize variable
actions.description: Stores the email address of the Microsoft 365 group responsible for the ticket.

actions.name: Create item
actions.description: Creates a new ticket and assigns it to the group stored in varAssignedToEmail.

actions.name: Send confirmation email
actions.description: Notifies the requester that the ticket has been created.
